learning_objectives.objective: Define key terms including Federal Contract Information (FCI), Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI), Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (C-SCRM), and System Security Plan (SSP).
Explain the purpose and structure of Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) levels and their alignment with NIST SP 800-171 controls for protecting FCI and CUI.

Identify specific security responsibilities of contractors (e.g., implementing NIST SP 800-171 controls, maintaining an SSP, achieving appropriate CMMC certification) in a given scenario involving handling CUI.
Compare and contrast NIST SP 800-171 (protecting CUI) with NIST SP 800-53 (security controls catalog) and NIST SP 800-172 (enhanced supply chain protections).
Assess a contractor's compliance with CMMC requirements based on a provided audit scenario or SSP excerpt.
Develop a sample outline for a System Security Plan (SSP) tailored to a contractor handling CUI under CMMC Level 2.
